isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

caution.para: Removal and installation of the heater core should be done with two (2) people, one inside and one outside of the cab to help guide the tube ends of the core through the dash panel seal. This will greatly reduce the possibility of the dash panel seal becoming damaged.

step1.para: Drain engine coolant. Refer to GROUP 12-COOLING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove lower right instrument panel cover, heater-A/C assembly cover and drain tray. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, LOWER RIGHT INSTRUMENT PANEL, HEATER-A/C ASSEMBLY COVER AND DRAIN TRAY.
Remove both heater hoses from heater tube connections, on engine side of dash panel.
From the engine side of the dash panel, run a screwdriver around both heater hose tubes protruding through the dash panel to separate sealant from the tubes ( Figure 8).
Remove one nut and lockwasher from the engine side of the dash panel that holds the heater core in place ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Remove Nut and Lockwasher Holding Heater Core in Place

note.para: Before removing the lower plate, make sure the black insulating tape is removed from the inner end of the plate.

step1.para: From inside the cab, remove heater core lower plate ( Figure 10).

From inside the cab, pull the heater core out of the heater-A/C unit ( Figure 11). From the engine compartment, someone should guide the ends of the heater hose tubes through the dash panel seal so the seal is not damaged by the heater hose connector tubes ( Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Pull Heater Core Out of Heater-A/C Unit

step1.para: From inside the cab, start the tube ends of the core through the dash panel seal. Because of the angle bend on the tubes, it will be very easy to damage the dash panel seal if the tubes are not guided through the seal from the engine side of the dash panel ( Figure 8). Guide the stud on the heater core into the hole in the dash panel ( Figure 9).
From inside the cab, install the heater core lower plate ( Figure 10).

note.para: After the heater core lower plate is installed, make sure the black insulating tape that seals off the opening at the inner end of the plate is fastened back on the plate.

step1.para: Install a lockwasher and nut on the stud, on the engine side of the dash panel ( Figure 9) and tighten to 6 to 8 ft-lbs. (8 to 11 N•m).
Fill the cooling system with coolant. Refer to the OPERATOR'S MANUAL.
Install lower right instrument panel cover, heater-A/C assembly cover and drain tray. Refer to LOWER RIGHT INSTRUMENT PANEL, HEATER-A/C ASSEMBLY COVER AND DRAIN TRAY.
